pages.title: Page 1
pages.text: There was an old donkey. He was too old to work. "I will go to Bremen Town," said the donkey. "I will be a musician! I will sing!" HEE-HAW! HEE-HAW! And off he went!

pages.title: Page 2
pages.text: On the path, the donkey saw a dog. The dog was sad. "What is wrong?" said the donkey. "I am too old to hunt," said the dog. "I have no home." WOOF! WOOF! (Sad woof.)

pages.title: Page 3
pages.text: "Come with me!" said the donkey. "We will go to Bremen Town! We will be musicians! We will sing!" "Yes!" said the dog. "I will come!" HEE-HAW! WOOF! WOOF! And off they went!

pages.title: Page 4
pages.text: On the path, they saw a cat. The cat was sad. "What is wrong?" said the donkey. "I am too old to catch mice," said the cat. "I have no home." MEOW... MEOW... (Sad meow.)

pages.title: Page 5
pages.text: "Come with us!" said the donkey. "We will go to Bremen Town! We will be musicians! We will sing!" "Yes!" said the cat. "I will come!" HEE-HAW! WOOF! MEOW! And off they went!

pages.title: Page 6
pages.text: On the path, they saw a rooster. The rooster was sad. "What is wrong?" said the donkey. "I am too old to wake people up," said the rooster. "I have no home." COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! (Sad crow.)

pages.title: Page 7
pages.text: "Come with us!" said the donkey. "We will go to Bremen Town! We will be musicians! We will sing!" "Yes!" said the rooster. "I will come!" HEE-HAW! WOOF! MEOW! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! And off they went!

pages.title: Page 8
pages.text: It got dark. They were tired. They were hungry. "We must stop for the night," said the donkey. Then the rooster saw a light! "Look! A house!" said the rooster.

pages.title: Page 9
pages.text: They crept to the house. The donkey looked in the window. "There are robbers in there!" said the donkey. "They are eating a big feast!" "I am so hungry!" said the dog.

pages.title: Page 10
pages.text: "Let's scare them out!" said the cat. "We will make music!" said the donkey. "Stand on my back!" said the donkey to the dog. "Stand on the dog!" said the donkey to the cat. "Stand on the cat!" said the donkey to the rooster. They made a tall tower!

pages.title: Page 11
pages.text: "Now... SING!" said the donkey. HEE-HAW! HEE-HAW! WOOF! WOOF! WOOF! MEOW! MEOW! MEOW! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! CRASH! They all fell through the window!

pages.title: Page 12
pages.text: The robbers were so scared! "A monster!" they yelled! The robbers ran out of the house! They ran and ran and ran! They did not come back!

pages.title: Page 13
pages.text: The four friends went into the house. They ate the feast. Munch, munch, munch! Then they went to sleep. The donkey slept by the door. The dog slept on the mat. The cat slept by the fire. The rooster slept on the roost.

pages.title: Page 14
pages.text: One robber crept back. He went into the dark house. Creak, creak, creak... Then...

pages.title: Page 15
pages.text: The cat scratched him! MEOW! The dog bit him! WOOF! The donkey kicked him! HEE-HAW! The rooster crowed at him! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! The robber ran away! "A terrible monster!" he yelled.

pages.title: Page 16
pages.text: The robbers never came back. The four friends lived in the house. They sang all the time! HEE-HAW! WOOF! MEOW! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! They were the Bremen Town Musicians! The lesson: Friends working together can do big things! The end! Onomatopoeia = Words that sound like what they mean! Animal Sounds in This Story: - Donkey: HEE-HAW! HEE-HAW! - Dog: WOOF! WOOF! WOOF! - Cat: MEOW! MEOW! MEOW! - Rooster: COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO! Other Sound Words: - CRASH! (falling through window) - Creak, creak, creak (door opening) - Munch, munch, munch (eating) Practice: What sounds do these make? - A door: SLAM! CREAK! - Eating: MUNCH! CRUNCH! - Water: SPLASH! DRIP! - Footsteps: STOMP! TAP! TIP-TOE! Initial Blends: - Bremen (br-) - friends (fr-) - stand (st-) - stomp (st-) - crept (cr-) - scare / scared (sc-) Final Blends: - roost (-st) - robbers (double consonant + blend) Practice Sentence: "My best friends will stand and stomp to scare the robbers in Bremen!" "What is wrong?" "I have no home." "Come with us! We will be musicians!" "HEE-HAW! WOOF! MEOW! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO!" "They ran and ran and ran!" 1. Who were the four animals? (donkey, dog, cat, rooster) 2. Where were they going? (Bremen Town) 3. What did they want to be? (musicians!) 4. Why were they all sad at first? (too old, no home) 5. What did they find? (a house with robbers) 6. How did they scare the robbers? (made loud music! HEE-HAW! WOOF! MEOW! COCK-A-DOODLE-DOO!) 7. What happened at the end? (they lived in the house together!) 8. What is the lesson? Act out the story's BEST part: - Four people (or stuffed animals!) stand on each other - (Safely! Maybe just stack toys or use your hands!) - Everyone makes their animal sound AT THE SAME TIME! - Fall down (gently!) like they crashed through the window! Lesson: Together, we can do BIG things! - Each person picks an animal - Make that animal's sound - "Conduct" the band: Point to each person, they make their sound! - Try it LOUD! Try it soft! Try it FAST! - You're musicians too! Animal Ideas: - Dog: WOOF! - Cat: MEOW! - Cow: MOO! - Pig: OINK! - Duck: QUACK! - Sheep: BAA! Find sound words in OTHER stories! - Billy Goats Gruff: Tap, tap, tap! Stomp, stomp, stomp! Nom, nom, nom! - Three Little Pigs: Huff, puff, WHOOSH, CRASH! - Goldilocks: Knock, knock! Creak, creak! CRACK! BOOM! Make a list! How many sound words can you find? | PROBLEM | SOLUTION | |---------|----------| | Animals have no home | They go to Bremen to be musicians | | They're hungry and tired | They find a house | | Robbers are in the house | They scare them away with music! | | Robbers might come back | Animals defend the house! | Lesson: Every problem has a solution! Work together! Put these in order: 1. Donkey meets dog 2. Dog meets cat 3. Cat meets rooster 4. They find house with robbers 5. They make music and scare robbers 6. They eat and sleep 7. Robber comes back 8. Animals scare him again! 9. They live happily in the house Each animal was: - Brave (faced the robbers!) - Helpful (helped each other) - Creative (made a plan to scare robbers) - Loyal (stuck together as friends) Talk about it: - Have YOU ever been brave? - How do YOU help your friends? - What creative ideas have YOU had? - Enormous Turnip: Everyone worked together to pull it up! - Bremen Musicians: Everyone worked together to scare robbers! - Little Red Hen: She did NOT work together (friends didn't help!) - Connection: Teamwork is powerful! Draw the four animals standing on each other: 1. Donkey on bottom (biggest) 2. Dog on donkey 3. Cat on dog 4. Rooster on top (smallest) Label each animal! Draw sound bubbles coming from their mouths! Billy the Goat says: "Just like the four animals became musicians by practicing their sounds together, YOU become a reader by practicing your LETTER SOUNDS together! HEE-HAW is made of sounds /h/ /ƒì/ /h/ /aw/! When you blend sounds, you make WORDS! That's music to my ears!" Also: The animals were all DIFFERENT (donkey, dog, cat, rooster), but together they were STRONGER! In reading, you use DIFFERENT skills together (sounds, blending, sight words) to become a STRONG reader! 1. Onomatopoeia focus: TONS of sound words! (Lesson 27 skill!) 2. Repetitive structure: Each animal joins, building pattern recognition 3. Animal sounds = phonics practice: Breaking sounds into parts 4. Blend practice: Bremen, friends, stand, stomp, crept, scared 5. Teamwork theme: Beautiful lesson about cooperation 6. FUN! Kids LOVE making animal sounds! 7. Cumulative story: Adds one animal at a time (like "The House That Jack Built") - Music: Animal sounds = music! Rhythm, loud/soft, conducting - Science: Animal sounds (what animals really sound like in nature?) - Social Studies: Cooperation, community, helping those in need - Character Education: Teamwork, bravery, friendship, loyalty - Drama: Perfect for acting out! - musician (someone who makes music) - onomatopoeia (words that sound like what they mean‚ÄîWOOF!, CRASH!, MEOW!) - robber (someone who steals) - feast (a big, fancy meal) - roost (where a bird sleeps) - tower (tall structure‚Äîthe animals stacked up!) - teamwork (working together) - Listen to animal sounds in music (Carnival of the Animals, Peter and the Wolf) - Make simple instruments (shake a box of rice = maracas!) - March like a band!
